result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Ryan Peschke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua Ryan Peschke is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joshua Ryan Peschke was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Joshua R. Peschke in court with attorney Cana G Kohn.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  17CF210,16CM136 & 17FO319 called at 3:45 pm  Plea agreement  17CF210 Amended Information filed. Ct 2 amended.  Ct 1 Plea, CT 2 DIR Ct 3 DRI Ct 4 plea Ct 5 DRI and CT 6 & DRI  16CM136 Disorderly conduct plea.  17FO319 plea.   17CM210 Ct 1 & 4 - Probation 2 yrs.  cost & DNA sur & sam.   AODA & follow through  Absolute sob.  Counseling as deemed.     Maintain full time employment/school 30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for.  16CM136  Impose 90 days jail, stay 1 yr probation. Cost and comply with conditions on 17CF210.   17FO319 plea and pay fine, suspension.  Waiver of preliminary was addressed previously per Atty Kohn.  Court reviews court record.  Plea questionnaire form completed and reviewed with def.   17CF210 Ct 1 - no contest plea.  Ct 4 - No contest   16CM136 Ct 1 disorderly conduct no contest -  no enhancer. 17FO319 - guilty plea   17CF210 Ct 2, 3,5,6, & 7 Dismissed and read in   Constitutional rights, right to jury trial and elements reviewed.  Court finds pleas entered freely & voluntarily.  Def understands charges, penalties and rights.  Factual basis.  17CF210 pleas accepts found guilty Ct 1 & 4.  16CM136 plea accepted, found guilty Ct 1.   Sentence arguments presented by Atty Gebert.  Atty Kohn request court to adopt joint recommendations, sentencing arguments presented.  Nothing by def.   Sentencing remarks by the court.  17CF210 Ct 1 Sentence withheld probation  2 yrs.   Cost & DNA surcharge & sample   AODA assessment and follow through.   Counseling as deemed necessary.  Absolute sobriety.    Maintain full time employment/school 30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for.  Ct 4 same sentence waive surcharge.   16CM136 90 days jail, 3 days cr.   Huber priv.  stayed probation 12 months   Cost  & DNA surcharge.  Same conditions  17FO319 Fine total 263.50  90 days suspension effective today.  Felony conviction rights reviewed.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  DNA sample already provided. Post conviction rights   17FO319 will pay today or first thing in morning

Court calls  17CF210, 16CM136 & 17FO319 @ 4:03 pm.  Defendant Joshua R. Peschke in court with attorney Cana G Kohn.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives plea agreement, 17CF210 plea to ct 1, & ct 2 plea, DRI remaining ct's 3-7  16CM136 Defer entry of judgment, revoked, plea to charge, D.C., domestic, 17FO319 plea to charge and pay, 16CM136 Domestic enhancer deleted.  17CF210 both ct's withheld sentence 2 years probation, concurrent, costs, DNA surcharge, AODA and follow through with treatment recommendation, Absolute Sobriety,   Maintain full time employment/school 35 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for. Counseling deemed. 16CM136 90 days jail, impose and stay 1 year probation, costs and same conditions, 17FO319 $263.50 and 1 year suspension.  Def. makes statement on suspension.  Atty Kohn and def. agrees with plea agreement.  Waiver of preliminary examination filed.    Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause and binds over. Information Filed electronically.  Atty Kohn has copy of information and waives reading. Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights. Def. understands charges and penalties.  Ct's 1 & 2 Poss of Narcotic Drgs 2nd offense, no contest plea. 16CM136 D.C, no contest plea. 17FO19 U.D. 2nd, no contest plea.  Court grants on State motion to DRI and consider for sentencing in Ct's 3-7. Def. advised of constitutional rights & J.T. rights.  Def. understands elements.  Def. admits prior conviction. Court will remove enhancer of Domestic in 16CM136.  Atty Kohn is satisfied. Court finds pleas are freely & voluntarily given.  Factual basis.  Court finds factual basis, accepts pleas and finds def. Guilty to 17CF210 Poss of Narcotic Drgs 2nds offense in ct's 1&2 and 16CM136 D.C. and Underage Drinking 2nd. State heard on error that case has not been properly charged.  Recess @ 4:23 pm. Reconvene @ 4:32 pm.  Court received Amended Information on Ct 2.  Atty Kohn has copy of amended information and waives reading.  Def. will continue.  State gives sentencing recommendation.  Atty Kohn gives remarks.  17FO319 Atty Kohn gives statute.  Def. makes statement.  State moves to adjourn case because to many errors in complaint, and withdrawal plea.  State explains to court. Atty Kohn agrees. Def. agrees to adjournment.  Court will not withdrawal plea at this time. Atty Kohn moves to withdrawal on all cases.  Court is allowing pleas to be withdrawn ct's 1 & 2. 16CM136 and 17FO319. Plea questionnaire given back to Atty Kohn
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 28, 2018 at 03:30 pm.
of Preliminary Examination - See 17-CF-210
